TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Rest/DirectMessages extends System.Object

MemberSignature.Value: public static CoreTweet.DirectMessage Destroy (CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<string,object>>[] Parameters);

.method public static hidebysig class CoreTweet.DirectMessage Destroy(class CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] Parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Destroys the direct message specified in the required ID parameter. The authenticating user must be the recipient of the specified direct message.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.

Docs.para: : The ID of the direct message to delete.
: The entities node will not be included when set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: public static CoreTweet.DirectMessage New (CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<string,object>>[] Parameters);

.method public static hidebysig class CoreTweet.DirectMessage New(class CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] Parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user. Requires both the user and text parameters and must be a POST. Returns the sent message in the requested format if successful.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.

Docs.para: Note: One of user_id or screen_name are required.
: The ID of the user who should receive the direct message. Helpful for disambiguating when a valid user ID is also a valid screen name.
: The screen name of the user who should receive the direct message. Helpful for disambiguating when a valid screen name is also a user ID.
: The text of your direct message. Be sure to URL encode as necessary, and keep the message under 140 characters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class CoreTweet.DirectMessage> Sent(class CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] Parameters) cil managed

.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class CoreTweet.DirectMessage> Show(class CoreTweet.Tokens Tokens, class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<string, object>>[] Parameters) cil managed

summary.para: Returns a single direct message, specified by an id parameter. Like the /1.1/direct_messages.format request, this method will include the user objects of the sender and recipient.
This method requires an access token with RWD (read, write and direct message) permissions.

Docs.para: : The ID of the direct message.
